ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: nor will you worship what I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Nor will you worship who I worship:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: nor are you going to worship Him Whom I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: nor will you worship what I shall worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Nor will you worship Whom I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nor will you worship that which I worship."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nor are you going to serve Him Whom I serve:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: neither are you serving what I serve
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: You will never worship what I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nor will ye be worshippers of that which I worship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: nor will you worship what I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nor will you worship that which I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: neither will you worship what I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Nor do you serve what I serve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Nor will you be worshippers of what I worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [109:5] nor will you worship, in the future, what I worship: God knew that they would never become believers (the use of [the inanimate] mā, ‘what’, to refer to God is meant to counter [the reference to ‘what thing’ they worship]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nor will ye worship that which I worship) that which I worshipped in the past; it is also said this means: I do not believe in the divinity in which you believe nor will I believe in the divinity which you believe in beside Allah nor will you believe in the divine Oneness of Allah which I believe in.
